title: Watering Wisdom
description: Water your plants only when the top inch of soil feels dry. Overwatering is a common mistake—most indoor plants prefer slightly dry conditions rather than soggy soil.
tip: Use room-temperature water and let excess drain out of the pot.

title: Sunlight & Placement
description: Most indoor plants thrive in bright, indirect sunlight. Direct sunlight can scorch leaves, while too little light can slow their growth.
tip: Place your plants near a window with filtered light or use a sheer curtain.

title: Fertilizing Made Simple
description: Feed your plants with a balanced, water-soluble fertilizer every 4–6 weeks during the growing season (spring and summer).
tip: Avoid fertilizing in winter—plants rest during this time.
